_prev_prog_2.FR_Comments: This facility and contractor complies with all Federal, State, and Local rules and regulations.
_prev_prog_2.PC_OtherType: PRV Manifold, Locking Devices, Quick Shut-off Valve
_prev_prog_2.TR_OtherType: How to conduct a safety meeting
_prev_prog_2.EquipmentTested: Main Shut-off Valve, Pressure Relief Valves, transfer lines, hoses, allother control valves
_prev_prog_2.Description: Typical Retail fertlizier, seed, and pesticide storage and distribution facility that will contract with the Reactor to convert anhydrous ammonia, phosphoric acid, and water into 10-34-00 fertilizer. Jimmy Gore Fertilizer retail, wholesale, or store Anhydrous Ammonia at this location or any other. The raw products will only be stored on our "rail spur" temporarily until conversion. It is part of the contractual arrangements between the two parties that each have proper safety features in place on all equipment, and have provided proper training of personel. At least every time the system is activated, a visual inspection takes place and at least once each year a documented inspection of all NH3 components is documented. All static pressure relief valves, hose fittings and appurtenances are in compliance with appropriate codes and regulations. All maintenance and repair are in accordance to K-61 standards utilizing appropriate material approved for the Anhydrous Industry.

_exec_summary.SummaryText:
Gore Feed & Fertilizer Facility Policy

This facility has been in business since 1974, and is a strong economic part of the community.  While
anhydrous ammonia is recognized to have dangerous characteristics, we have chosen a contractor
to handle the product that is an expert in managing this product.  Our community may be subject to some
exposure under a total catastrophic release, but the danger is mitigated by the amount of time that the
product is on-site.  For twenty-eight years, we, as well as the contractor have proven anhydrous ammonia
can be stored and transferred safely.  The community has not been subjected to any exposure as a results
of a release of ammonia vapor.  The contractor's equipment is well maintained and equiped with all 
standard safety devices the ammonia industry requires.   While we do not anticipate a release, we have
an emergency action plan filed with the local emergency planning committee, the local fire department,
and the local Sheriff's Department.  We maintain an open dialogue with the LEPC and fire department and
encourage them to attend a training seminar at our business, which they have done, so they are
familliar with the process.  Our employees, along with the contractor, the community LEPC, local law
enforcement, local fire department are in position to reduce the threat of anhydrous ammonia reaching
the community or residential neighbors.  We are committed to protect the general public from the risks
associated with the anhydrous ammonia  industry and to assure the public and our employees that
safety is foremost at Gore  Feed & Fertilizer in Comanche, TX.

2.  Primary Activity

Gore Feed & Fertilizer is an agriculture business.  We supply agriculture products to other dealers and
local farmers who produce food and farm products for families in the United States and our local 
dairies.

3.  Worst-Case Release Scenario and Alternative Release Scenario

    a.  The worse-case release scenario would be the release of the total

contents of the 78-ton
railcar release over a 10-minute period.  The maximum quantity release would be 156,000 pounds
which represents the normal shipping volume of a railcar operating at design standards.  The distance
to the endpoint (point of dispersion to 200 ppm) is 6.9 miles as calculated using RMP Comp.

   B.  The alternative release scenario based on the most likely potential incident is a release from a
transfer hose that may rupture under pressure.  A total of 250 pounds of ammonia could be released
from a ruptured hose within a 10-minute period that may be required to completely mitigate the release.
The distance to the endpoint (point of dispersion to 200 ppm) is 0.1 miles as calculated using RMP Comp.
